header.title: The Enochian Magick of Dr. John Dee

central_thesis: Geoffrey James's edition presents John Dee's original Enochian magical system as a complex, highly structured system of angelic communication and evocation. The system, allegedly received through scrying sessions with Edward Kelley, aims to restore a lost divine wisdom and grant the practitioner access to earthly knowledge, aid, victory, and spiritual understanding.

structure_content.chapter_title: BOOK ONE: THE MAGICK OF ENOCH
structure_content.summary: This section lays the theological and historical groundwork for Enochian magic. It details the system's supposed divine origin, revealed to Enoch, its subsequent loss, and its re-establishment through Dee and Kelley's angelic interactions. It introduces the nature of this 'wisdom,' the primal language, and the foundational principles of angelic communication.

This book describes the practical preparations for engaging with the Heptarchical system. It outlines the essential ritual furniture, notably the Holy Table and the Sigillum Dei Æmeth. Detailed descriptions of the Seven Heptarchical Kings, Princes, and their Ministers are provided, alongside specific prayers, invitations, and their daily offices, crucial for communication with these planetary entities.

structure_content.chapter_title: BOOK THREE: THE FORTY-EIGHT ANGELIC KEYS
structure_content.summary: This core section presents the complete corpus of the 48 Enochian Calls or Keys. Each Call is given in its original Enochian language with corresponding English translations. These invocations are the primary means of opening celestial regions ('Aethyrs') and summoning various angelic orders and individual intelligences for diverse magical operations.

structure_content.chapter_title: BOOK FOUR: EARTHLY KNOWLEDGE, AID & VICTORY
structure_content.summary: This part links the angelic hierarchy to terrestrial domains. It categorizes geographic regions and lists their corresponding angelic governors, often with numerical values. This mapping implies a system for invoking angels to influence specific earthly matters, gain knowledge about the world, and secure aid or victory in various endeavors.

structure_content.chapter_title: BOOK FIVE: THE ANGELS OF THE FOUR QUARTERS
structure_content.summary: Focusing on the 'Great Table' (Table of Earth) and its corrected form, this book introduces the twenty-four Seniors and provides their specific invocations. It systematically details numerous classes of angels (e.g., of Medicine, Precious Stones, Transformation, Elements) associated with each of the four elemental quarters, including their God Names and Angel names.

structure_content.chapter_title: APPENDIX A: THE PRACTICE OF ENOCHIAN EVOCATION
structure_content.summary: This appendix serves as a practical manual for performing Enochian evocations. It details the necessary personnel (Magus, Scryer), ritual equipment (Holy Table, Sigillum Dei Æmeth, shewstone, ritual cloths), prayers, descriptions of angelic hierarchies, talismanic construction, proper scheduling, and ceremonial procedures for successful angelic communication.

The editor's preface contextualizes Dee and Kelley's work, discussing the nature of the original manuscripts, the challenges of translation, and the aim to present an 'unexpurgated form' of the system. It also touches upon the historical debates surrounding the veracity of Dee's angelic encounters and their psychological or objective interpretations.

key_concepts.definition: A complex ceremonial magic system allegedly revealed by angelic intelligences to John Dee and Edward Kelley in the late 16th century. It utilizes a unique 'Angelic' language, specific ritual objects, and hierarchical structures to communicate with and, potentially, command angels.

A central ritual altar or table used in Dee's scrying operations, upon which various sacred seals and sigils, including the Sigillum Dei Æmeth, are placed to act as a spiritual conduit for angelic communication.

key_concepts.term: Sigillum Dei Æmeth (Seal of God's Truth)
key_concepts.definition: A complex, multi-layered wax seal engraved with numerous divine and angelic names, serving as the primary physical interface between the Magus and the angelic realms during Enochian scrying sessions. Multiple versions and layers of these seals were used.
The crystal or obsidian mirror, or other suitable surface, used by Edward Kelley as the medium through which he would perceive and relay the visions and messages of the angels to John Dee.

The initial angelic system received by Dee and Kelley, detailing a hierarchy of seven kings, seven princes, and their ministers, who are associated with the planets and days of the week, governing vast aspects of cosmic and terrestrial order. Focuses on wisdom and governance.

A unique, revealed language with its own alphabet and grammar, purportedly communicated directly by angels. It is used in the invocations and calls, believed to be the true language of celestial intelligences, containing inherent magical power.

A series of 48 potent invocations written in the Enochian language. Each Key is designed to 'open' a specific celestial or terrestrial region (an 'Aethyr') and summon distinct orders or individual angelic intelligences for various magical purposes and revelations.

key_concepts.term: The Great Table (Table of Earth/Watchtower Table)
key_concepts.definition: A large square table of 2604 letters, meticulously derived from angelic instructions. It is divided into four elemental quarters and serves as the source for numerous elemental and sub-elemental angelic names, including the influential 24 Seniors. It is fundamental for elemental and terrestrial operations.

A specific group of powerful angelic intelligences derived from the Great Table, associated with the four elemental quarters. They are invoked for various purposes, including healing, transformation, obtaining knowledge, and influencing natural substances and human arts.

practical_system.description: The Enochian system, as presented, is a highly structured, hierarchical system of angelic communication and evocation. It relies on specific ritual tools (Holy Table, Sigillum Dei Æmeth, shewstone), a unique angelic language for invocations (Enochian Keys), and precise ceremonial procedures designed to summon various classes of angels (Heptarchical, from the Great Table) for obtaining divine wisdom, knowledge, power, and practical aid across diverse domains (geography, elements, medicine, arts, etc.). The system emphasizes purity, devotion, and strict adherence to the revealed instructions, requiring both a Magus (scribe) and a Scryer.
tools: The Holy Table (Table of Practice) with its supporting feet and specific dimensions.
The seven Sigillum Dei Æmeth, complex wax seals placed beneath the legs of the Holy Table and under the shewstone.
A Shewstone (scrying crystal or obsidian mirror) for angelic visions.
A red silk cloth covering the Holy Table, embroidered with specific designs.
Four wax tablets placed at the corners of the table, engraved with the names of the elemental kings.
Twelve banners representing the four quarters, emblazoned with angelic names and sigils.
The Magical Book, which is the collected record of Enochian communications.
Specific talismans, often made of 'sweet wood' and engraved with angelic characters, for different operations.
rituals: Invocation of Heptarchical Kings, Princes, and Ministers using specific prayers, daily offices, and appropriate talismans and banners.
Recitation of the 48 Enochian Keys (Calls) to 'open' various Aethyrs or summon specific angelic hierarchies associated with different quarters and purposes.
Use of the shewstone by a scryer to perceive and record visions, messages, and instructions from the angelic intelligences.
Construction and ceremonial placement of specific talismans made of 'sweet wood' for particular angelic groups and operations.
Ritual purification, fasting, fervent prayer, and strict adherence to precise scheduling (days, hours) for optimal angelic contact.
Engagement with the elemental Watchtower angels derived from the Great Table for specific terrestrial and elemental operations.

relevant_quotes.text: The Most Powerful System of Magick in Its Original Unexpurgated Form

The Enochian Magick of Dr. John Dee. © 1984, 1994 by Geoffrey James. All rights reserved. Printed in the United States of America. No part of this book may be reproduced in any manner whatsoever without written permission from Llewellyn Publications, except in the case of brief quotations embodied in critical articles and reviews.
This is the Holy Table, by which ye shall attain to the true knowledge…from it also ye shall learn the true Enochian wisdom
The Magus was definitely required to construct a talisman for each group of Angels that he wished to conjure. These were made of 'sweet wood', with the characters 'painted' upon them.
The twenty-four Seniors…whose names are compiled from the lines of the father, the Son, and the Holy Ghost. The duty of these Good Angels is to impart knowledge and judgement in human affairs.

critical_analysis.relevance: This edition is highly relevant for serious students and practitioners of Western Esotericism and ceremonial magic, particularly those dedicated to the Enochian tradition. It offers a direct, 'unexpurgated' translation of Dee's original diaries, providing a foundational text for understanding the system as it was initially received, prior to later interpretations by groups like the Golden Dawn or Aleister Crowley. Its historical importance for the development of modern occultism is immense, influencing countless subsequent magical systems. It serves as a vital resource for reconstructing and engaging with the historical practice of Enochian magic.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of experienced ceremonial magicians, academic researchers in esotericism and occult history, and advanced students of magical traditions. Due to its dense, complex, and unexpurgated nature, it is not suitable as an introductory text. Practitioners seeking to rigorously reconstruct or engage with historical Enochian magic will find it invaluable.
